header.title: The Watcher (November 1990CE XXV AS, No. 5)
authors: Christos Beest (Order of the Nine Angles)
Carl Abrahamsson (Thee Temple ov Psychick Youth)
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Satanism, Left Hand Path, Anarchism

central_thesis: This issue of 'The Watcher' critically examines the societal 'Satanic Panic' while simultaneously exploring diverse Left Hand Path philosophies and practices, emphasizing individual autonomy, self-deification, transgression of static norms, and the pursuit of transformative personal and Aeonic change within various occult traditions (LaVeyan, Setian, Chaos, Sinister), often aligning with anarchistic ideals.

structure_content.summary: This article analyzes the escalating anti-Satanism moral panic in the USA, UK, and South Africa, fueled by Christian fundamentalists, media, and some law enforcement. It highlights the baselessness of ritual abuse claims, citing an FBI study, and critiques the irrationality and 'idiotic proportions' of the hysteria, contrasting it with more rational police approaches.

structure_content.chapter_title: THE SECRET LIFE OF A SATANIST by Blanche Barton (Book Review)
structure_content.summary: A review of Blanche Barton's biography of Anton LaVey, outlining his early life, philosophical development, and the eventual formation of the Church of Satan. It emphasizes LaVey's rejection of conventional morality, his embrace of individualism, and his eventual reclusive lifestyle.

structure_content.chapter_title: Fire & Ice: Magical Teachings of Germany's Greatest Secret Occult Order by Dr S Edred Flowers (Book Review)
structure_content.summary: This review details Stephen Edred Flowers' book on the Fraternitas Saturni (FS), describing its Luciferian-Gnostic cosmology centered on the planet Saturn. It covers the FS's Thelemic-Nietzschean philosophy, its synthesis of occult traditions, and its 'notorious' sex-magick rites like Gradus Pentalphae.

structure_content.chapter_title: ZEALOTS PUSHING FOR ARMAGEDDON By Elisha ben Azazel
structure_content.summary: An article analyzing the actions and historical intentions of Zionist Zealots (ZZ) regarding the Dome of the Rock/Aqsa Mosque. It connects their religious motivations to a desire for an 'Israeli Empire' and a calculated provocation of a 'Holy War,' set against the backdrop of contemporary geopolitics.

This section comprises letters from various occult groups and individuals, including the band Beherit clarifying their Satanic music's philosophy, Carl Abrahamsson of Thee Temple ov Psychick Youth, and Adam Parfrey of Feral House. Topics range from the nature of Satanic metal to critiques of esoteric egoism and discussions of T.O.P.Y.'s principles.

structure_content.chapter_title: THEE TEMPLE OV PSYCHICK YOUTH: What we do and why we do it!
structure_content.summary: A manifesto outlining T.O.P.Y.'s philosophy as a non-hierarchical, individual-focused Magickal Order dedicated to self-improvement and the removal of repressive elements. It defines 'evil' and 'good' in terms of personal alignment and promotes 'Magick' as the art of causing change in conformity with Will, within a global 'Occulture' network.

An esoteric exposition on 'The Dark Gods' as acausal entities/energies, distinct from conventional interpretations. It discusses the 'Dark Tradition' and 'refined magickal techniques' like the 'Rite of Nine Angles' for invoking these forces to usher in a new 'Galactic' Aeon, emphasizing the strong's survival in this transformative process.

structure_content.chapter_title: THE FIRST REBEL By Illuminatus / WHAT IS SATAN?
structure_content.summary: This article, drawing on Mikhail Bakunin and Paul Carus, defines Satan as the 'proto-Anarchist' and 'Anti-God.' It positions Satan as a symbol of free-will, rebellion against static authority, and a catalyst for human progress, explicitly distinguishing philosophical Satanism from 'devil worship'.

key_concepts.definition: A moral panic, largely Christian-driven, characterized by unsubstantiated claims of Satanic ritual abuse, animal sacrifice, and cult infiltration, often perpetuated by sensationalist media and misguided law enforcement.

A broad spiritual and philosophical orientation focused on individual sovereignty, self-deification, transgression of conventional norms, and often anti-theistic or Luciferian principles, distinct from traditional 'devil worship'.

A symbolic or archetypal figure, particularly as interpreted by Bakunin and Carus, representing free-will, rebellion against static, 'godly-tyranny,' progress, and human ascent through self-liberation, rather than a malevolent deity for worship.

The process of 'becoming' or self-creation; the evolution of individual psychecentric consciousness towards its own divinity through the deliberate exercise of intelligence and will, central to the Temple of Set's philosophy.

Acausal entities/energies, often perceived as terrifying to the uninitiated, associated with the 'Dark Tradition' and 'refined magickal techniques' (e.g., Rite of Nine Angles) for initiating Aeonic shifts towards a new 'Galactic' era.

As defined by Thee Temple ov Psychick Youth, 'the art and science of causing change to occur in conformity with Will,' focused on individual self-improvement, the removal of repressive elements, and the expression of confidence and personal Will within a non-hierarchical 'Occulture' framework.

A German Luciferian-Gnostic order (1926-1970) whose cosmology is centered on the planet Saturn, incorporating a 'Thelemic-Nietzschean' philosophy and synthesizing various occult traditions, including specific sex-magick practices like the 'Gradus Pentalphae'.

In the context of 'The Dark Gods,' these refer to distinct eras of human consciousness and planetary influence, with the current Aeon nearing its end and a new 'Galactic' Aeon being ushered in, partly through the invocation of 'The Dark Gods'.

practical_system.description: The document outlines operative principles and references to practical systems from multiple Left Hand Path traditions. It highlights individualized magical development, the use of Will for transformation, and engagement with potent, often transgressive, energies for both personal and Aeonic change. The systems presented range from philosophical self-actualization to ritualistic invocation and world-altering magic.
tools: Intellectual tools: Self-consciousness, intelligence, individual Will, critical thinking.
Ritual components: Blood (specifically menstrual form for ONA practices), black candles (referenced in the context of witch-hunt confiscations).
rituals: Temple of Set: The process of Xeper, focusing on the evolution of consciousness through disciplined will and intelligence.
Fraternitas Saturni: Luciferian-Gnostic practices to achieve gnosis through concentration on Saturnian energies, including the 'Gradus Pentalphae' (a sex rite).

Thee Temple ov Psychick Youth: 'Magick' as a means to effect change in conformity with Will, leading to individual 'Great Work' (principles for self-transformation rather than specific ritual scripts are detailed).

Order of the Nine Angles: 'Refined magickal techniques' such as the 'Rite of Nine Angles' for 'weaken[ing] a Star Gate' and invoking 'The Dark Gods' to initiate Aeonic shifts; mentioned to replace older 'bloody shamblings,' with menstrual blood noted as a modern component.

relevant_quotes.text: The author has discovered that the facts of so-called 'satanic crimes' are often significantly different from what is described at law enforcement training conferences or in the media. The actual involvement of satanism or the occult in these cases usually turns out to be secondary, insignificant, or nonexistent.
No one ever 'gets to know' Anton LaVey", writes Barton. "If you're lucky you glimpse enough to know you don't know much about him."

The fact is that far more crime and child abuse has been committed by zealots in the name of God, Jesus and Mohammed than has ever been committed in the name of satan. Many people don't like that statement, but few can argue with it.

We believe that all repressive elements, whether they are social, personal or whatever, should be seen as obstacles o your path that you should seek to remove with Joy. The Joy of Life, the Joy of Will, and the Joy of Magick.
The definition of "evil" must always be "that which is anti-you". The definition of "good" must always be "that which is pro-you".
Satan is the first free-thinker and Saviour of the World. He frees Adam and impresses the seal of humanity and liberty on his forehead, by making him disobedient.

Satan is the embodiment of those forces which lead to progress and human ascent by upsetting the static order. Thus we see the rationale for Bakunin's championing of Satan, for he is the proto-Anarchist.

They lurk at the threshold of existence Preening their wings and eyes and sounds which they send forth to all who have ears to hear and minds to know... To understand Them is to pass that Abyss beyond which the man ceases to be.

critical_analysis.relevance: The document is highly relevant for understanding the late 20th-century 'Satanic Panic' and its counter-narratives from diverse Left Hand Path perspectives. It showcases the philosophical depth and practical variety within LHP traditions (LaVeyan, Setian, Chaos, Sinister), moving beyond simplistic media portrayals. It also serves as a historical snapshot of early occult networking and publication in print and nascent digital forms, positioning these movements within broader socio-political discussions.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience includes individuals deeply interested in Western Esotericism, Occultism, and Left Hand Path philosophies and practices. It appeals to researchers of social panics, counter-culture historians, and practitioners seeking alternative spiritual or magical paths that prioritize individual sovereignty, critical thought, and anti-establishment viewpoints. The technical language and comparative analysis also make it suitable for academic study in these fields.
